result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:23 AM Defendant Anthony M Grudziadz Jr not in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Anthony M Grudziadz Jr.  Attorney Andrea M Will in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense does not know why the Defendant does not appear today. 

State was prepared for trial. State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. State requests to remove jury trial. Court will order same.

Hearing on May 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:27 AM Defendant Anthony M Grudziadz in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Department Deputy Anthony Ledvina sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Will.  Cross examination by Attorney Klein.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Klein objects to bind over with argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defense Demand for Discovery.

02:10 PM Defendant Anthony M Grudziadz in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing on March 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $1,000.00.  ONCE THE COURT RECEIVES THIS MONEY, IT IS TO BE APPLIED TO THE BOND.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:00 PM Defendant Anthony M Grudziadz in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant states he posted $1,000 cash bail and presents the Court with a receipt.  Once this money is received by the Court it is to be applied to the bond.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
